Hi -

We have discovered here that the JUnit classloader doesn't respect a 
JAR's Class-Path manifest entry, and thus will not load classes from 
JARs only referenced in this manifest entry (and not located on the 
system classpath). Has anyone else encountered this problem and got 
to a workable solution or workaround? We have modified the JUnit 
source to get this working, but:
 
 - is there a particular reason why it isn't (there seems
   to be explicit comments in the code saying it doesn't work)
 - any plans to get it working?

Thanks
Peter Mularien
Deploy Solutions, Inc.
